item.title: 8 Best RPGs That Start Small and Expand Gradually
item.description:
Summary

  • In these RPGs, the world scale gradually expands to ease players in.
  • Games introduce lore subtly, letting players explore at their own pace.
  • Plot twists and alliances build gradually, enriching the player experience.

The best role-playing games know how to ease players into their world without overwhelming them with content. These RPGs are all the more memorable because players can explore the world at their own pace instead of feeling like they have to explore massive sandboxes and accomplish everything they set their minds to.

With the RPG genre more popular than ever, it's easy to see why players would seek out games that are dripping with lore without making them feel like outsiders to the ongoing events. Numerous plot devices ensure that the scope of the game gradually increases with the player's understanding.

8 Horizon Zero Dawn

The Game's World Slowly Expands As The Plot Develops, Easing Players Into The Massive Sandbox

Horizon Zero Dawn was an impressive first step for Guerrilla Games who wanted to kickstart an impressive IP. Aloy's adventures as an outcast start out small. She tries her best to participate in a trial and be accepted by others.

However, when this trial goes south, Aloy must fight for her life and embark on an epic adventure to understand how the world was corrupted in the first place. The lore is amazing and ensures that players will have a great time uncovering all the pieces as the story becomes more engrossing over time.

7 Kenshi

Players Have No Idea How Massive This Game's Scope Is When They're Dropped Into The World Out Of Nowhere

The freedom that Kenshi offers can be ridiculously overwhelming at first, with players being dropped into a settlement based on their beginning and slowly carving a legacy for themselves. In time, players will realize that leveling up their combat skills is a must if they don't want to be torn apart by the hostilities present in the world.

Once they're comfortable adventuring to their heart's content, players can check out the wealth of gameplay mechanics that they can experiment with. From becoming respected traders to starting a settlement of their own, the possibilities in Kenshi are endless. It helps that these opportunities blossom naturally as players make progress, eventually letting them do whatever they set their minds to as long as they have the resources and followers to aid them in their quest.

6 Deus Ex

Players Have No Idea How Multi-Layered The Game's Plot Is

When players start Deus Ex , all they're told is that the NSF are terrorists and UNATCO is on the side of good. However, simply completing the first mission is enough to prove that not everything is as it seems.

The questions posed by the NSF terrorists are genuinely compelling and do a great job of instilling a sense of doubt in players. As the scope of the plot expands, new allies are formed while former alliances turn against JC. The twists and turns of this plot ensure that players will have enough time to understand the complexities of Deus Ex 's world before eventually deciding its fate in one of three fleshed-out endings.

5 Final Fantasy 7

The Extended Intro In The City Of Midgar Is A Great Precursor For The Grand Adventure That Follows

One of the greatest JRPGs ever made, Final Fantasy 7 's intense introduction set the stage for a grand adventure. Players are restricted to the setting of Midgar for around ten hours, witnessing Shinra's malice firsthand and how the people in this city are suffering because of the greed of capitalism.

Eventually, after storming the Shinra building and mounting a daring escape, players finally get to step into the game's overworld for the first time. It's a great introduction to this mechanic for new JRPG fans who will love how grand the adventure feels after players finally get to step out of Midgar.

4 Chrono Trigger

A Simple Trip To A Festival Transforms Into A Time-Travelling Adventure For The Ages

Chrono Trigger is a charming game that makes it seem like players are just enjoying a festival in the first few hours of the game. However, after some time-traveling shenanigans ensue and Crono is arrested, it's clear that there's more to this story than what meets the eye.

Traveling to different timelines gives players a taste of the plot's heightened stakes before they finally get to control the Epoch, letting them travel to different time periods at will. The masterful first half of this game makes it all the more natural for players to get this control, letting them take on Lavos whenever they wish in the hopes of unlocking one of many unique endings.

3 Persona 5

It Takes Many Hours For Players To Reach The Meat Of The Game

Most Persona fans are aware of the slow start in these games, and the fifth mainline entry is no exception here. The game takes a long time to let the player and Joker get comfortable in the city of Tokyo before they finally get access to the Metaverse app.

Even after their first incursion in Kamoshida's Palace, it takes a while for Ann to join the party and for the first infiltration mission to start. It comes after a long wait, but most people enjoy the slow starts of Persona games as they get acquainted with the real world before dipping their toes into the metaphysical one.

2 Star Wars: Knights Of The Old Republic

The Gradual Increase In The Plot's Scope And The Player's Powers Makes Complete Sense Near The End

When players wake up on a spaceship that's under assault, they have no understanding of what's going on until a Republic soldier gives them the context they need. Following a grand escape, the player lands on Taris, with the game progressing to the next stage of the story.

As the foundations of the plot are laid down, players barely get to access their Force powers and can't even wield a lightsaber for a long time. Eventually, as their skills and weapon selection expand, they travel to different worlds and complete various quests. The player is more powerful than the regular Jedi at this point, which is when a groundbreaking plot twist uncovers that recontextualizes the game's events and lets players either reform themselves or join the Dark Side yet again.

1 The Outer Worlds

Players Must Do Some Legwork Before Eventually Getting To Fly Their Spaceship

The player character in The Outer Worlds is a Hope colonist who is released from a cryogenic pod and lands on Terra 2, near the Emerald Vale colony. Before they can embark on their spacefaring adventures with an appropriate ship, the player must solve a dilemma on this planet that has major ramifications.

It slowly introduces the combat and role-playing mechanics of this game before players make the big decision and power up the Unreliable. It's a great way to slowly open things up for the player, giving them a basic understanding of the hyper-capitalism at play here before they get to influence how things play out.

item.title: The Stone of Madness: Who Should You Give the Stone to?
item.description:
Quick Links

  • The Stone of Madness Campaign Choice Explained
  • Who Should You Give the Madness Stone to?
  • The Best Way to Play The Stone of Madness’ Campaign

The Stone of Madness lets you choose between two different campaign paths right after the prologue, the game’s training phase. What beginner players might not realize is that these two paths lead to entirely separate mission series, each offering unique twists on the story! It’s important to choose wisely, picking the path that won’t overwhelm you with puzzles and mysteries or the one that’s not too simple—if you are a hardcore player.

If you want to find out which campaign in The Stone of Madness best suits your playing style and expectations, check out the following guide. It breaks down the differences between each route and recommends which one to start with based on your preferences.

The Stone of Madness Campaign Choice Explained

After discovering the strange madness stone, you must choose who to give it to: the Inquisitor from the Church or Panecillo, the mysterious trader. Each choice launches a different campaign with its own unique storyline.

Campaign

Detail

The Gate of Saint Jerome

Starts with Panecillo and is longer

The Corrupt Hands of the Church

Starts with the Inquisitor and is shorter

Each campaign consists of four chapters, and you’ll earn five achievements by completing each (ten in total).

The Gate of Saint Jerome

If you decide to give the stone to Panecillo, you’ll embark on a journey to escape the monastery. The key difference between this path and the Corrupt Hands of the Church is that this one takes longer to complete.

Campaign introduction: “The party will find a mysterious key, triggering a quest to uncover the inhabitants of the monastery’s dark secrets and to finally escape the accursed place through the most obvious route—the main entrance, the Gate of Saint Jerome.”

The Corrupt Hands of the Church

If you give the stone to the Inquisitor, you’ll begin investigating the corruption in the monastery, collecting evidence to report to the authorities, the Holy Office. This campaign is shorter than The Gate of Saint Jerome and follows a different path.

Campaign introduction : “The Inquisitor, taking advantage of the Abbot’s poor health, has taken de facto control of the monastery. Father Alfredo will soon discover that the inmates are in serious danger. Luckily, they can count on an unexpected ally.”

Who Should You Give the Madness Stone to?

It’s recommended that beginner players start with the Corrupt Hands of the Church campaign. This path is shorter and features missions that are more beginner-friendly. Additionally, it is a great way to familiarize yourself with the game’s mechanics, preparing you for the longer, more challenging missions on the Saint Jerome path.

The Best Way to Play The Stone of Madness’ Campaign

Ideally, start two save files and complete each prologue before diving into any campaigns. With these save files, you can first complete the shorter path (The Corrupt Hands of the Church) and then immediately switch to the other save file to tackle the more extended campaign (The Gate of Saint Jerome).

I highly recommend investing time in both paths, as they feature well-designed missions and enjoyable puzzles. If you’re short on time, though, go with the longer campaign, as it offers the closest experience to the full game.

item.title: Need For Speed Heat: Fastest Cars In The Game, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Need for Speed Heat offers a wide range of cars for players, catering to various playstyles and preferences.
  • Top cars like McLaren P1, Koenigsegg Regera, and Ferrari LaFerrari offer high speeds, power, and strategic advantages in gameplay.
  • Players can unlock and customize cars to optimize performance and dominate races, with careful consideration of stats and upgrades.

The Need For Speed franchise has been rather diverse in what they offer players. Some games in the series are for car enthusiasts, others are for players who like the arcade feeling of the racing series. But whatever the reason, Need For Speed has left an imprint on gaming. Though the franchise isn't perfect, it still offers a lot for players in terms of what they can do, so each game in the Need For Speed series has something for everyone.

This makes Need For Speed: Heat accessible to a wide range of players. In addition, being an open-world racing game makes it one of the best games in the series. However, the way each game plays is only half of any Need For Speed game. The cars make up a large part of any racing game. If players want to get the most out of this title, they should look for some of the fastest cars Need For Speed: Heat has to offer.

Updated January 28, 2025 by Vlad Mazanko: Need for Speed Heat brought a refreshing twist to the NFS formula with its well-executed day-and-night mechanic, a feature later carried over with minimal changes into the latest installment, NFS Unbound. This dynamic system introduced a roguelike element, where players race to earn cash during the day and valuable Rep at night, unlocking new rides and tuning parts along the way.

To stay competitive in both phases of this gameplay loop, having a car capable of reaching breakneck speeds and dominating the competition is essential. This updated list highlights the fastest cars in NFS Heat, complete with detailed stats like top speed and price for each vehicle.

20 Mazda RX-7 Spirit R 2002

An Early, Versatile Car With Great Potential For Upgrades

  • Base Top Speed: 159 MPH
  • Base Performance Rating: 144
  • Base Horsepower: 276 bhp
  • Base Acceleration (0 to 60 mph): 4.80 secs
  • Cost: $59,500
  • How To Unlock: Unlocked At Rep Level 4

Mazda's cars are great for many things in Need For Speed: Heat, they can be great for off-road action, and be amazing cars for racing. The RX-7 is a versatile car , one that players can keep using through most of the game, and since Need For Speed: Heat's story is surprisingly well-told, going through the narrative with this car can feel more rewarding.

For players who want to drift with ease, the RX-7 is just for them. With minor upgrades, they can do these types of events or moves a lot easier. Boasting a top speed of 159 mph, players can dominate quickly most events. The great thing about the Mazda RX-7 is that it requires a rep level of 4 to unlock, so if players grind early, and do big-ticket events, they can unlock a car that can be modified to what they want.

19 Porsche 911 Carrera RSR 2.8 1973

A Fast Beast In Every Department, Capable Of Leaving More Expensive Rides Far Behind

  • Base Top Speed: 174 MPH
  • Base Performance Rating: 188
  • Base Horsepower: 308 bhp
  • Base Acceleration (0 to 60 mph): 5.00 secs
  • Cost: $86,000
  • How To Unlock: Unlocked At Rep Level 16

Most Need for Speed veterans are well aware of a car that may not look the part but can comfortably leave most other cars in the dust when push comes to shove. In fact, in the hands of a skilled racer, the RSR is a beast with no equal. As one would expect, following some investment, this car is capable of being one of the fastest vehicles in a Need for Speed game once again.

It doesn't matter whether players use this car for on-track races, offroad tracks, or a mix of both — the RSR is a beast in every department and can comfortably beat most vehicles that have more powerful customizations as long as the setup is done with great care. If players race against opponents at the same or lower level, then they'll have no problems completely humiliating these so-called "opponents".

18 Chevrolet Camaro Z/28 2014

One Of The Most Potent And Charged Classic Muscle Cars In The Game

  • Base Top Speed: 177 MPH
  • Base Performance Rating: 206
  • Base Horsepower: 504 bhp
  • Base Acceleration (0 to 60 mph): 3.90 secs
  • Cost: $93,000
  • How To Unlock: Unlocked At Rep Level 18

The Camaro is among the fastest cars in NFS Heat , one that has been in most of the other Need For Speed games. In Need For Speed: Heat, it has a little more going on. Many players who own the Z/28 will think that because it's a muscle car, it's not good at much aside from speed. This is untrue, while the Z/28 is fast, with top speeds of 177 mph, it also has exceptionally good handling, which makes it easy to race. Plus, the best way to escape cops is by outrunning them, the Z/28 does this in a very fluid manner with its high acceleration stat.

It's also a very dynamic car, meaning the Z/28 can be driven in any style provided it's upgraded to do so. While the Z/28 is a fast car, it can also be one of the best drifting cars in Need For Speed: Heat, because of its handling and breaking. Sadly, it is a grind to get, but if players win and play well, getting to rep level 18 can be done sooner.

17 BMW M3 E46 GTR 2006

A Legendary Pre-Tuned Variant That Is A Delight To Drive

  • Base Top Speed: 177 MPH
  • Base Performance Rating: 174
  • Base Horsepower: 345 bhp
  • Base Acceleration (0 to 60 mph): 4.60 secs
  • Cost: $202,000
  • How To Unlock: Unlocked After Completing The Campaign Story

Fans who have played older Need For Speed games will recognize this classic car. For an older car, the M3 still holds a punch and can stand out on its own. On top of that, with minor upgrades, the M3 can be quicker than the fastest cars on this list. While it's not as expensive as the faster cars featured here, it still needs players to grind. But, once they unlock the M3, it feels more rewarding. Need For Speed: Heat's open world is amazing, full, and immersive, driving with the M3, highlights the beauty of the world in the game.

As mentioned before, players may want to upgrade it, but won't need to as much, since it can reach a top speed of 177 mph, which is impressive for a car that can be considered out of its prime. Plus, with the rep level required to unlock the stock M3 being 7, getting it would be a breeze, much like the RX-7.

16 Polestar 1 2020

A Car From The Game's Cover Expectedly Delivers The Thrills

  • Base Top Speed: 193 MPH
  • Base Performance Rating: 247
  • Base Horsepower: 600 bhp
  • Base Acceleration (0 to 60 mph): 3.43 secs
  • Cost: $162,000
  • How To Unlock: Unlocked At Rep Level 22

For players who may not know much about this car, it's a luxury car under the Volvo brand, so the Polestar has similar qualities. This is a huge benefit because Volvo cars are rather fast and reliable. Being the cover car for Need For Speed: Heat, players may think it's just for show, but once they unlock it and drive it, they'll see how much power the Polestar can give the player. With top speeds reaching around the 193 mph mark, players who own this car will make every race a Sunday drive.

If they choose to upgrade the Polestar 1, the car can become a real threat to cops and other drivers. Plus, going online, owners of the Polestar will get an advantage of top speed, and also fast acceleration . However, unlocking this car requires a lot of work, since it needs a rep level of 22. There is a "Hero" edition of the Polestar with the same stats, but players need to beat the main game, plus the driving mission of Need For Speed: Heat to unlock it.

15 Lamborghini Huracán 2018

Probably The Best For Lambo Lovers

  • Base Top Speed: 199 MPH
  • Base Performance Rating: 208
  • Base Horsepower: 572 bhp
  • Base Acceleration (0 to 60 mph): 3.20 secs
  • Cost: $183,500
  • How To Unlock: Unlocked At Rep Level 24

Lamborghini is synonymous with speed on the racing scene, and the Huracán is one of the best models players can acquire in Need for Speed Heat . Its impressive acceleration from a standstill and top speed potential nearing 200 mph make it a must-have for those who prefer stock variants with minimal upgrades . However, there's limited room for further enhancement with the Lamborghini Huracán.

For players looking to go all out, additional Huracán variants are available, including the boosted Performante edition. Each model offers different responsiveness in suspension, gearbox, and throttle, catering to various driving preferences.

14 Ferrari F40 1988

Beauty And The Beast — All In A Single Alluring Package

  • Base Top Speed: 201 MPH
  • Base Performance Rating: 266
  • Base Horsepower: 471 bhp
  • Base Acceleration (0 to 60 mph): 3.90 secs
  • Cost: $547,000
  • How To Unlock: Unlocked At Rep Level 24

Many cars can speed through races and get amazing lap times with great finesse, but some players who share a love for this Italian car brand would love to use a Ferrari to leave their opponents in the dust. There are more than enough candidates that players can check out in this department, but one particular vehicle that stands above the rest of the pack is the Ferrari F40.

This car is a veritable speed demon that can overpower opposition racers in no time with its amazing performance. It's easy to see why so many players love using the Ferrari F40, with the car's classic look and amazing performance making it a no-brainer for NFS veterans who want to zoom past other racers in style.

13 Porsche 911 GT2 RS 2018

The Ultimate Modern Reimagining Of The Iconic Porsche Classic

  • Base Top Speed: 211 MPH
  • Base Performance Rating : 313
  • Base Horsepower: 691 bhp
  • Base Acceleration (0 to 60 mph): 2.70 secs
  • Cost: $246,500
  • How To Unlock: Unlocked At Rep Level 32

In terms of top speed, the Porsche 911 GT2 RS falls just slightly behind the 918 Spyder. However, fans of the classic, timeless Porsche design might still favor the 911 over the newer, flashier model. Additionally, the 911 GT2 RS is unlocked notably faster than its counterpart and comes at half the cost, making it a more accessible option.

The 911 GT2 RS features the most powerful engine ever installed in a 911 , paired with an aerodynamic bodywork package designed to enhance downforce, ventilation, and overall driving and handling capabilities. Statistically, the 911 GT2 RS can hold its own against some of the fastest race cars in NFS Heat . While its visual customization options are limited due to its "Icon Car" status, this isn't much of a drawback for drivers seeking the signature Porsche appeal and performance that this powerhouse confidently delivers.

12 Lamborghini Murciélago SV 2010

A Series Staple, Renowned For Its Speed And Reliability

  • Base Top Speed: 213 MPH
  • Base Performance Rating: 294
  • Base Horsepower : 661 bhp
  • Base Acceleration (0 to 60 mph): 3 secs
  • Cost: $335,500
  • How To Unlock: Unlocked At Rep Level 32

The Lamborghini Murciélago SV stands as the most powerful model in the Murciélago lineup . Its reduced weight, achieved through the use of carbon fiber components for the front and rear fenders and a lighter exhaust system, showcases a modern approach to supercar assembly. Additionally, the SV generates more raw power thanks to a new intake system and enhanced valve timing.

These upgrades enable the Murciélago SV to effortlessly achieve a top speed of 213 mph in Need for Speed Heat . For fans of the Italian supercar brand, choosing between the Murciélago, Aventador, and Huracán models often comes down to personal preference in design. Each delivers the speed and acceleration Lamborghini is renowned for, ensuring none will disappoint.

11 Porsche 918 Spyder 2015

The Latest And Fastest Chapter In Porsche's Rich Legacy

  • Base Top Speed: 214 MPH
  • Base Performance Rating: 341
  • Base Horsepower: 868 bhp
  • Base Acceleration (0 to 60 mph): 2.50 secs
  • Cost: $591,500
  • How To Unlock: Unlocked At Rep Level 36

The only notable drawback of the Porsche 918 Spyder in Need for Speed Heat is its steep price. In every other aspect, this car is an engineering marvel, almost too pristine for the rough world of aggressive street racing and high-stakes pursuits. This hybrid supercar features two additional electric motors and can run entirely on electric power. However, for maximum performance, the 918 Spyder combines these with its cutting-edge 4.6L V8 engine, enabling it to rocket from 0 to 60 mph in just 2.5 seconds and reach a blistering top speed of 214 mph.

Unlike the 911 GT2 RS, the 918 Spyder utilizes an all-wheel-drive (AWD) system, offering distinct handling characteristics compared to other Porsche models. Drivers need not worry, though, as the AWD setup is exceptionally responsive and reliable , allowing for sharp cornering at very high speeds without sacrificing control.

10 Ford GT 2017

Blending Exotic And Muscle Strengths

  • Base Top Speed: 216 MPH
  • Base Performance Rating: 327
  • Base Horsepower: 646 bhp
  • Base Acceleration (0 to 60 mph): 2.90 secs
  • Cost: $342,500
  • How To Unlock: Unlocked At Rep Level 36

One of the best cars in Need For Speed Heat , the Ford GT packs a massive punch in this game. With faster-than-lighting acceleration, and a high top speed of 216 mph to back it up, owners of the Ford GT can and will dominate any race. Players may get faster cars than the GT, but what makes it a car that players should keep driving for as long as they can, is the adaptability it has. Fast cars usually suffer in the handling area, which is why players may focus on that stat.

For the GT most stats are well-balanced, turning on a dime can be done fluidly, and doing last-second maneuvers can be easy. It's a great car for players who want to start getting into the quicker cars in Need For Speed: Heat. However, like most of the cars on this list, they need to unlock it. While a rep level of 36 may seem like a chore at first, once players unlock and buy the GT, Need For Speed: Heat will have a different feel.

9 Chevrolet Corvette ZR1 2019

A Roaring Speed Demon That Dominates Its Price Range

  • Base Top Speed: 217 MPH
  • Base Performance Rating: 315
  • Base Horsepower: 755 bhp
  • Base Acceleration (0 to 60 mph): 3.10 secs
  • Cost: $142,500
  • How To Unlock: Unlocked At Rep Level 32

For its price, the Chevrolet Corvette ZR1 is an absolute steal. It's one of the fastest cars in Need for Speed Heat with a sub-$150,000 price tag, making it a no-brainer for budget-conscious players seeking a high-performance rocket. As a quintessential modern American muscle car, the ZR1's signature rear-wheel-drive (RWD) setup is perfect for players who enjoy long, controlled drifts around corners and lightning-fast acceleration off the line.

Although the ZR1 offers limited visual customization options in the game, its aggressive sports body hardly needs additional flair. With its prominent rear spoiler and front splitter designed for increased downforce, the ZR1 already exudes a sleek, supercharged style ideal for street racing fans.

8 McLaren P1 2015

A Perfectly Balanced Supercar With Loads Of Potential

  • Base Top Speed: 217 MPH
  • Base Performance Rating: 346
  • Base Horsepower: 903 bhp
  • Base Acceleration (0 to 60 mph): 2.80 secs
  • Cost: $776,500
  • How To Unlock: Unlocked At Rep Level 40

Once players get to the higher-performance cars, they'll notice there are a lot of compromises. For example, top speed may be the highlight, but at the cost of acceleration or handling. However, players who have this McLaren won't face much on an issue. What makes the P1 stand out from its peers, is that it's an all-around balanced car, with every section working in harmony. The best part is that players don't need to upgrade it that much, but since the Need for Speed games encourage players to do so, it still isn't a bad idea.

With this car, players can win any race and escape all cop chases, even if they get to a level 5 chase. If players opt to run with P1, they'll see a lot more wins. Still, they should note that even though it's one of the fastest, it's not the fastest . But because it's a balanced supercar, players won't struggle as much to keep up.

7 Pagani Huayra BC 2017

A Track-Focused Exotic Ride That Hardly Needs Further Improvements

  • Base Top Speed: 217 MPH
  • Base Performance Rating: 338
  • Base Horsepower: 754 bhp
  • Base Acceleration (0 to 60 mph): 2.90 secs
  • Cost: $1,574,000
  • How To Unlock: Unlocked At Rep Level 36

As one of the most exotic and expensive cars in Need for Speed Heat , alongside the Koenigsegg Regera, the Pagani Huayra BC is a top choice for high-speed enthusiasts who love leaving competitors or cops in the dust on straightaways. Although this hypercar has limited performance upgrade options, its stock stats are among the highest in the game , and its bodywork is exquisite as-is.

The Huayra BC is a track-focused variant of the original Huayra, designed for peak performance. With only 20 models ever produced, players get the thrill of driving this exclusive speed demon in NFS Heat .

6 Ferrari FXX-K Evo 2018

Devilish Speed Can Coexist With Prime Handling

  • Base Top Speed: 217 MPH
  • Base Performance Rating: 363
  • Base Horsepower: 1,035 bhp
  • Base Acceleration (0 to 60 mph): 2.50 secs
  • Cost: $2,177,500
  • How To Unlock: Unlocked At Rep Level 50

This is not only a really fast car, but it has one of the best engines in the whole game . The FXX-K gives so much to players in terms of speed and power, and when fending off police during the chases, the FXX becomes the player's best friend. At the start, the FXX will push players to the first-place position. It's one of the highest-rated cars in Need For Speed: Heat for acceleration, and gets better per upgrade.

However, just like the rest of the cars on this list, it's a must for players to stay on the road with it. They can lose control immediately on any uneven surface. This aspect won't be much of an issue, because the FXX-K has some of the best handling, which will give its driver a run for their money. Racing in this car won't give players much of an issue, as long as they stay on a normal road. With the power and acceleration together, the owner of this car will be a threat even to the faster players.

5 McLaren P1 GTR 2015

An Ultimate Road Warrior That May Be Just A Little Too Pricey

  • Base Top Speed: 217 MPH
  • Base Performance Rating: 363
  • Base Horsepower: 986 bhp
  • Base Acceleration (0 to 60 mph): 2.40 secs
  • Cost: $2,120,500
  • How To Unlock: Unlocked At Rep Level 40

One of the best things about Need For Speed: Heat is that it gives players tons of options. Having multiple cars from the same brand gives players a lot to choose from. The P1 GTR showcases that. If players want a safer, less stressful race, they can choose its little brother, the standard P1 listed above. But, for players who dare to live a little, the P1 GTR is for them.

This car takes everything from the P1 to another level. Though it has a slightly lower top speed (which can be upgraded), players can own the roads in this. The Need For Speed: Heat upgrade system works like an RPG, meaning there are tiers of parts players can get. The P1 GTR can easily get those elite and ultimate parts. As long as they use this guide, their car will be kitted for anything. Even when it's fully upgraded, the P1 GTR is best for roads, so players should stay on them as much as possible because the off-road is rather unforgiving.

4 Lamborghini Aventador SVJ 2019

Fast, Powerful, And Available In A Variety Of Impressive Variants

  • Base Top Speed: 218 MPH
  • Base Performance Rating: 331
  • Base Horsepower: 759 bhp
  • Base Acceleration (0 to 60 mph) : 2.80 secs
  • Cost: $384,000
  • How To Unlock: Unlocked At Rep Level 36

Need for Speed Heat offers several Lamborghini Aventador SVJ models, including coupe, roadster, and SV variations . As a track-ready, pre-tuned version, the Aventador SVJ features enhanced bodywork designed for extreme downforce, keeping the car firmly planted during high-speed maneuvers. With its "Icon Car" status, players should note that all Aventador SVJ models have limited visual customization options — a common trait among the fastest and most expensive cars in the game.

While the Aventador SVJ delivers an impressive top speed, its acceleration sadly isn't as groundbreaking, placing it behind some entries listed above, so players who often need quick bursts of speed after sharp turns or during intense police chases should keep that in mind. However, its relatively affordable price makes it an attainable choice for most players once they reach Rep Level 36.

3 Ferrari LaFerrari 2016

The Best Ferrari Fans Of The Iconic Brand Can Get

  • Base Top Speed: 218 MPH
  • Base Performance Rating: 360
  • Base Horsepower: 949 bhp
  • Base Acceleration (0 to 60 mph): 2.80 secs
  • Cost: $1,104,500
  • How To Unlock: Unlocked At Rep Level 40

A small step up from the McLaren P1, players will have a hard time picking between the two. Both are great cars and do well in all areas. However, players who pick the LaFarrari will have something of an edge, which will only get bigger with upgrades. The LaFerrari has better acceleration and more horsepower overall than the P1, but owners of the P1 can upgrade to keep up.

The good news is that the LaFerrari is even more customizable than the P1. While the P1 has a certain limit, the LaFerrari does not have the same limit as far as customization goes. However, the LaFerrari is not as balanced as the P1 and does take more time to get used to. But it makes up for that in other areas, like the horsepower and its top speed. It is lower to the ground, so it can only be driven on one type of surface — in cop chases this will be very important. It is, for sure, one of the fastest cars in NFS Heat .

2 McLaren F1 1993

A Superior Choice That's Not For Everyone

  • Base Top Speed: 221 MPH
  • Base Performance Rating: 326
  • Base Horsepower: 618 bhp
  • Base Acceleration (0 to 60 mph): 3.20 secs
  • Cost: N/A (Paid DLC Exclusive)
  • How To Unlock: Unlocked For Pickup From Port Murphy After Reaching Rep Level 30

While it's a shame that one of the best cars in Need for Speed Heat is a vehicle that can only be acquired via paid DLC , that shouldn't take away from the allure of the McLaren F1, which is the perfect car for speedfreaks. Boasting amazing stats from the get-go that can be propelled to greater heights, players who get their hands on the McLaren F1 will be more than pleased by what this car brings to the table.

Most opponents have no chance against a souped-up and upgraded version of this car, which can reach breakneck speeds that only the most skilled racers around will find easy to control. DLC comments aside, the McLaren F1 deserves its plaudits as one of the fastest cars in Need for Speed Heat that is marginally beaten out by one other vehicle.

1 Koenigsegg Regera 2016

The Fastest And Most Exclusive With No Caveats

  • Base Top Speed: 255 MPH
  • Base Performance Rating: 400+
  • Base Horsepower: 1,500 bhp
  • Base Acceleration (0 to 60 mph): 2.70 secs
  • Cost: $1,227,500
  • How To Unlock: Unlocked At Rep Level 50

If players come across the Regera, which is not only a hard car to beat but also the fastest car with the upgrades, picking it is an easy choice. Since Need For Speed: Heat uses the Frostbite engine, players can see how gorgeous the game looks at top speeds. The Regera allows players to do that, and keep safe at the same time. With its near-perfect handling and its cannon-like launch , players will be ahead of others more often than not.

The interesting part about the Regera is that it's oddly decent on the off-road parts of the world, although players will face issues when going in those spots. But unlike the other cars on this list, drivers who use the Regera off-road will be less impacted by it. This, in turn, makes it a very versatile car and does something for any type of driver.

item.title: Destiny 2 Fans Have Big Complaint About the Game's Story
item.description:
Summary

  • Destiny 2 fans aren't happy about the delivery of story content in Episodes due to the lack of engaging narrative beats and cutscenes.
  • Some players in the community want Bungie to adopt a new narrative approach for Destiny 2, with more cutscenes and less NPC dialogue.
  • Other fans believe the Episode structure wastes the potential of the Destiny universe and its many characters.

Destiny fans are disappointed and unhappy with the delivery of story content for Destiny 2 over the past few months. Many players want to see the story unfold instead of being told about events and Destiny's history through NPC dialogue, while other Destiny 2 fans believe the story lacks engaging narrative beats and cutscenes heading into Episode: Heresy.

After the release of Destiny 2's The Final Shape expansion, Bungie began to tell a new story in the aftermath of the Witness' defeat. The story of Destiny 2 is being told in Episodes, which have seasonal content that's distributed within three Acts and weekly updates. The topic of Episodes has been contentious in the community, since many players believe its structure is too similar to the previous seasonal model.

Reddit user Crafty_Trick_7300 recently shared some thoughts and complaints about story content delivery in Destiny 2 , commenting that they're tired of hearing NPCs talk about feats achieved by the player or other historical figures in Destiny's universe. Crafty_Trick_7300 would like to see Bungie approach a new method of narrative content delivery without "word-vomit" from NPCs or the game's current "tell, don't show" approach. The player is also upset that Bungie has resources to create animations and in-game cutscenes, but many of the game's NPCs only talk to players in a static spot. Crafty_Trick_7300 also noted that they've seen "live service indie games" with better narratives than Destiny 2 , despite Bungie having resources under the Sony umbrella.

Destiny 2 Fans Aren't Happy About the Game's Story and Approach to Storytelling With NPCs

Many players in the Destiny 2 community on Reddit appear to agree with Crafty_Trick_3000's sentiment, and some fans mention the issues they've had with the story following the release of the Destiny 2: Lightfall expansion. Others feel burnt out with the story of Destiny 2 , and believe that its current Episode structure wastes the potential of the Destiny universe and its many characters.

Destiny 2's Codename: Frontiers could potentially bring major changes to story structuring and delivery, but important details that fans would like to know still haven't been revealed by Bungie yet. On February 4, Destiny 2 will head into the first Act of Episode: Heresy, which sees players return to the Dreadnaught from the beloved Destiny: The Taken King expansion. Episode: Heresy will introduce a new activity called "The Nether," new weapons and gear, a Star Wars collaboration, new subclass aspects, and much more. Three days later, the Sundered Doctrine dungeon will launch on February 7. More details about Codename: Frontiers could be revealed further in the course of Episode: Heresy, which will receive three acts just like Episode: Revenant.

While there are more revolvers, they are just rare variants that offer no real stat increases, and as such, it’s a good opportunity to discuss the best revolvers in Red Dead Redemption 2 ’s story mode.

For players who want to have the fastest gun in the West, knowing Red Dead Redemption 2 ’s best revolvers, along with their stats and what makes them so good, is going to be imperative if players are supposed to win a shootout or a duel as a legendary outlaw.

The Cattleman Revolver is a classic, an all-around great revolver that has decent stats to make any gunslinger happy. However, there are superior options out there, but for now, it’s time to shine some light on the Cattleman Revolver.

The Cattleman Revolver has decent damage, decent accuracy, a fast reload, and a rapid-fire rate.
